Item.text: Create virtual serial port using HHD Software Free Virtual Serial Ports.
Make this port available on a remote computer using HHD Software Remote Serial Ports Server.
Make a remote serial port available on this computer using HHD Software Remote Serial Ports Client.
Launch HHD Software Virtual USB Tools Client to virtually connect remote USB device to this computer.
Launch HHD Software Virtual USB Tools Server to share this USB device over the network.

To start monitoring, locate the serial, USB or network device you want to monitor in the [[[v#[toolwindow.devices]# ]]] [[[hDevices Tool Window]]] and double-click it.

Double-click the [[[iNext connected device]]] entry in a corresponding category to monitor the next device of this type connected to the computer.

Log files of the preivously recorded monitoring sessions are also available in this list under the "Recorded sessions" sub-categories.

Message.description: Notification: VSPT and VUSB info popup

Item.text:
We also offer products that allow creation of virtual serial and USB devices that emulate real physical devices.

[[[v#[vspt.appicon]# ]]] [[[hVirtual Serial Port Tools]]] supports creation of virtual serial ports, local or remote bridges. It allows sharing of exising serial ports over the network or even creating serial ports controlled by a script.

[[[v#[vusb.appicon]# ]]] [[[hVirtual USB Tools]]] provides a way to virtually transfer an USB device from one computer to another over the network, without the need of physically reconnecting it.

In addition to serial device monitoring support, Device Monitoring Studio can monitor the connection between two distinct serial devices.\n\nConnect both serial devices to two PC serial ports and create new [[[v#[cmd.bridge.new]# ]]] [[[hSerial Bridge]]]. After the created bridge appears in [[[v#[toolwindow.devices]# ]]] [[[hDevices Tool Window]]] double-click it to re-establish the connection between serial devices and start monitoring.
